item.title: Furniture, fridge and building rubbish dumping at the back of my house, 15th June
item.description:
People are constantly dumping a range of things at the back of the houses. including a fridge, furniture, household rubbish and rubble. It makes it impossible for me to get my car in/out unless I move things. I move things in the morning and by the time I come home, I have to move things again. I have had to replace 3 tyres over the last two years, due to nails in pieces of furniture piercing my tyres. my car has been damaged when I have not been able to see the obstacle, because it is dark and it wasn't there when I left. Fortunately I do not drive my care every day, however, whether I am going to work, dressed for an event, or just shopping, at least once a week, I have put gloves on and pick up or move stuff or shovel rubbish out of the way. This rubbish has attracted large rats which I have seen in the alley and in my neighbours garden. I am afraid to leave the back door open in case they come into my garden and into my house. Other people use the alley as a dog toilet, but the rubbish is distressing and making me anxious every time I open the garage door, as I do not know what to expect or what I will need to do to get the car safely out out. Something needs to be done for well being and health and safety reasons

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Road, Slade Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several bags of rubbish and broken glass, 15th June
item.description:
This is a hazard for children and adults who use this pavement on the way to and from school and nursery. I have sweep up the broken glass into a pile and into the road as far as possible but it needs cleaning up.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
